{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3477753,"name":"Corbin Kuster","username":"CKioxide","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ckioxide/{size}/235143_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-10T07:36:54.663Z","cooked":"

I’m interested in a few uses for our 2025 robot CAD, including sketch-type outlines for cool t-shirt designs and a spec sheet poster for our pit. What can I do to make pictures look better than just a screenshot, and where would I even start for an outline rendering? I currently use OnShape, but I have access to Autodesk tools if they have anything good for this. What have you guys done before, or currently do, or heard of? Thanks for any pointers, on behalf of 4513 I hope Reefscape is an excellent year for all teams.

I think we were able to export this as a drawing in Solidworks (maybe even as an svg). Then clean it up a little in Photoshop.

Have a search around the forum for “robot wireframe render” or similar keywords. If you can’t find stuff I can give looking a shot tomorrow.

In Onshape, if you use print (in the hamburger menu in the top left), and then hit download image you’ll get a much higher resolution photo than you would with a screenshot. And it has a transparent background too!

And if it’s helpful here are some other posts that talk a little bit about two different kind of “render styles”:

Silhouette Robot Designs General Forum
[3729 Silouette] For this I exported a PNG of the robot shaded CAD from Onshape using the print feature, then used the brightness bitmap feature in Inkscape with the threshold at like .99 to one-color-ify and vector-ify it then manually deleted all the little holes. Only took about 10 minutes and I’d like to think it turned out pretty well. Hopefully, it’ll be a vinyl sticker on our shop door in the coming days…
How to make those outline robot images teams often use in merchandise Other
In Onshape you can turn off shading in the view settings, then in the hamburger menu click print, frame your robot, then download image for a very high resolution transparent export of the wireframe. Edit, result example: [3729 drive team binder]
